page.title: 19Leisure centers in Bestwood
page.content:
In Bestwood there are lots of Leisure activities like: Swimming, gyms, libraries, parks, and more to keep you occupied for the day.

Swimming costs £2 normally however; if you have a city card it will only cost £1! There are diving boards, toys (like swimming floats and others) a little pool (for children if they don't want to go in the big pool although adults can go in too) and a big pool for all ages.

A city card is a card that gets things cheaper for you. Like: bus fairs, for the swimming pool, to buy books, to give you a discount on your shopping and loads more!

At the library you can sit and read a book or you can take books out of the library to borrow and then bring back when you have read it.

Also if you don't have a computer at home you can go on the computers there.



If you want you can go to the gym and it will cost £26 a month. It keeps you fit and healthy. But remember to take a drink because you might get hot and thirsty.

Not everybody spends their leisure time in Bestwood. We are really close to the city so it's only a short bus ride to do things like ice skating. When you go ice skating (in Nottingham city) it will cost about £6- £8. And if adults don't want to go on the ice they can sit at the side and watch or enjoy a delicious meal or cup of tea at the side of the ice rink.

Some of the parks in Bestwood are:

Queens Bower park (also known Bullifield), Chedisten, The ridge, Southglade park and Moswood.



So if you don't know what to do one day

Then why don't you visit one of these Leisure activities?



By Nieeve


Class 6 Glade Hill Primary
